item.title: Interrupts (ä¸­æ–­)
item.description: Abstract Â§ When an interrupt occurs, Program Counter jumps to Interrupt Handler (Interrupt Service Routine, ISR) & execute 2 forms - Signal (Software Interrupt) & Hardware interrupts (å¤–ä¸­æ–­) Benefits Â§ We donâ€™t need to get CPU to keep Polling for response which may take a long time to produce.

item.title: Integer Encoding (æ•°å­—ç¼–ç )
item.description: Abstract Â§ There are 3 Variants, computer use the 2â€™s Complement (è¡¥ç ) variant to store integer Computers use 2â€™s Complement (è¡¥ç ) to store the integers, since it solves the flaws in Sign-and-Magnitude (åŸç ) and 1â€™s Complement (åç ) Below is a 4-bits Integer Encoding under the 3 Variants 3 Variants Â§ Sign-and-Magnitude (åŸç ) Â§ Represent positive and negative decimal integers in binary with the help of Sign Bit Divide the number of bits into 2 parts, one part for negative number, another part for positive number Require extra Logic Gates The Adder logic gates cant be used for subtraction This can be avoided using 1â€™s Complement (åç ) or 2â€™s Complement (è¡¥ç ) 1â€™s Complement (åç ) Â§ For negative number, all bits are inverted except the Sign Bit which is 1 and positive number unchanged We can invert all bits except Sign Bit to obtain Sign-and-Magnitude (åŸç ) Reuse Logic Gates We re-can use Adder logic gates, without building extra logic circuit like a subtraction logic gates Mathematically wrong definition of 0 We have +0 (when all bits are 0) & -0(when all bits are 1) under this encoding, this can be solved by 2â€™s Complement (è¡¥ç ) 2â€™s Complement (è¡¥ç ) Â§ This builds on top of 1â€™s Complement (åç ), the only difference is to add extra 1 to the negative number in 1â€™s Complement (åç ) to have only 1 binary encoding for 0 We can calculate the decimal value by taking the value Sign Bit (negative) and perform addition with value of Magnitude (all are positive) Terminologies Â§ Sign Bit Â§ The first bit from left 0 denotes positive 1 denotes negative Magnitude Â§ All the bits in the encoding except Sign Bit Reference Â§ Sign-and-Magnitude Addition and Subtraction Hello-Algo .

item.title: Problem Solving
item.description: Abstract Â§ Systematic way of solving a given problem 9 Tips Â§ 1. Use the defining features of the set-up Â§ Look at what is given Ask the definition of each term How the ideas piece up together (infer) Example 1: Approaching a problem related to Circle, Inscribed Angle Theorem.

item.title: Dockerfile
item.description: Abstract Â§ Set of steps for Docker to build Docker Container Keywords Â§ ENV Â§ Set the Environment Variable in the Docker Container .

item.title: Docker Build
item.description: Abstract Â§ Convert Dockerfile to Docker Container Cautions Â§ â€”build-arg Â§ Used to pass dynamic values to Engine for the building process Not Environment Variable, that is set with [[Dockerfile#env|ENV]] Frontend Build Â§ Needs the Environment Variable at the container build stage only, not when the container is running .

item.title: Configuration File, Vault
item.description: #vault Config file for HashiCorp Vault. Contains different keywords to tune the behaviour of the vault like what storage backend to use & how to unseal the vault etc Some of the config can be done using the specific Environment Variable Can be written in either JSON or HCL Some networking related setting can be set dynamically using go-sockaddr template TCP Listener Example [cluster_address,api_addr] Example Example Production Configuration File seal Â§ # Below is using AWS KMS for [[Auto Unseal]] seal "awskms" { region = "ap-southeast-1" kms_key_id = "5b2b78c8-c4db-43d9-ba6b-73295f2ec154" } Example vault.

item.description: Abstract Â§ Note ğŸŒŸ denotes tools & settings I must have in MacOS to have a smooth user/developer experience GUI Apps Â§ Install Firefox (Replaced with floorp) ğŸŒŸ Install Bypass Paywalls Install Dropbox Install Obsidian ğŸŒŸ Install Keypass (Replaced with Install StrongBox from App Store) ğŸŒŸ Install VSC ğŸŒŸ Add code into cli Install Termius ğŸŒŸ Modify Default Shell Install Tutanota ğŸŒŸ Install Notion ğŸŒŸ Install Docker (Replaced with OrbStack) ğŸŒŸ Install Podman Install Node Version Manager, npm included ğŸŒŸ Install Postman Install GitKraken ğŸŒŸ Install Brave Install MySQL Workbench Install Google Drive Client ğŸŒŸ Install Java JDK ğŸŒŸ Install IntelliJ Community ğŸŒŸ Install VirtualBox Install Ngrok # Move Ngrok Executable to PATH cp ngrok /Users/<USERNAME>/.

item.title: Type System
item.description: #software_engineering#cs2030s What is it? A set of rules how variables, expressions & functions interact with each other Covers Sub-types Compule-time Types Run-time Types Parameterized Types (Generics, Generic Types) Type Inference (ç±»å‹æ¨æ–­) Custom Types .

item.title: Type Inference (ç±»å‹æ¨æ–­)
item.description: Abstract Â§ Compiler or Interpreter automatically figure out the Datatype based on the context For example, in [Java, we can do List<Integer> intList = new ArrayList<>() instead of List<Integer> intList = new ArrayList<Integer>(), the Compiler is smart enough to figure out the Datatype for ArrayList based on the context provided by List<Integer> Reduce boilerplate code - more concise & readable Too much may reduce the readability .

item.title: Application Performance Monitoring (APM)
item.description: Abstract Â§ Collect Trace from backend application code Deep visibility into applications with out-of-the-box performance dashboards for web services, queues, and databases to monitor requests, errors and latency .
